t: Psalm 34
The Happiness of Those Who Trust in God
A Psalm of David when he pretended madness before Abimelech, who drove him away, and he departed.
I*pn will bless the Lord*s at all times; His*ld praise shall*i continually be*i in my mouth.
My*ld soul shall make its boast in the Lord;*s The*ld humble shall hear of*i it*i and be glad.
Oh,*ld magnify the Lord*s with me, And*ld let us exalt His name together.
I*ln sought the Lord,*s and He heard me, And*ld delivered me from all my fears.
They*ld looked to Him and were radiant, And*ld their faces were not ashamed.
This*ld poor man cried out, and the Lord*s heard him,*i And*ld saved him out of all his troubles.
The*ld angel of the Lord*s encamps all around those who fear Him, And*ld delivers them.
Oh,*ln taste and see that the Lord*s is*i good; Blessed*ld is*i the man who*i trusts in Him!
Oh,*ld fear the Lord,*s you His saints! There*ild is*i no want to those who fear Him.
The*ld young lions lack and suffer hunger; But*ld those who seek the Lord*s shall not lack any good thing.*i
Come,*ln you children, listen to me; I*ld will teach you the fear of the Lord.*s
Who*ld is*i the man who*i desires life, And*ld loves many*i days, that he may see good?
Keep*ld your tongue from evil, And*ld your lips from speaking deceit.

The*ln eyes of the Lord*s are*i on the righteous, And*ld His ears are*i open*i to their cry.
